New Records: Nicholas Pooran equalled India's record set in 2007 by former all-rounder Yuvraj Singh with six sixes against England.
Nicholas Pooran also surpassed Chris Gayle (124 sixes) as West Indies' most decorated T20I six-hitter.
West Indies notched up the highest first-innings total in the ongoing event and their highest total in the T20 World Cups.
Key Match Events: Nicholas Pooran scored a record-equalling 36 runs off Azmatullah Omarzai's over in the T20 World Cup match between Afghanistan and West Indies in Gros Islet in their last group stage match.
Pooran's brutal assault of 98 runs propelled West Indies to 218/5.
Nicholas Pooran was eventually run-out in the last over.
Post-Match Reflections: West Indies beat Afghanistan by a massive 104 runs.
Miscellaneous Highlights: It is an unwanted record for Afghanistan seamer Omarzai, who conceded a total of 36 in one over during the Powerplay.
During his innings Pooran also smashed three sixes and a pair of fours during Omarzai's second over.
